gremlins

Class Creature

  • java.lang.Object
    • gremlins.GameObject
      • gremlins.Creature
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Gremlin, Wizard

    public class Creature
extends GameObject
    Creature class extended from GameObject class and implemented the Moving interface, a superclass for wizard and gremlin objects. Aside from methods and variables introduced in GameObjects, introduces direction, velocity and collision variables as well as a generic method for checking wall collision.

      • Creature

        public Creature(int x,
                int y,

        y - y coordinate

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        Move the creature. Done by taking the current direction and increment coordinates based on velocity

      • checkCollisionWall

        public <T extends GameObject> boolean checkCollisionWall(java.util.ArrayList<T> list,
                                                         java.lang.String direction)
        Generic class for detecting wall collision. Loop through every walls to see if any is blocking the direction of movement. Has GameObject as upperbound for parameter, but is mainly used for Stonewall and Brickwall.
        Parameters:
        list - a generic list of objects (stone/brick)
        direction - the creature's current direction
        Returns:
        whether the creature has collided with a wall or not
